means: （错误、罪过等）轻微的，可原谅的

sentence.Network_en: Her poverty had been a venial fault for two gallant gentlemen.
sentence.Network_cn: 她的贫穷对那两位殷勤的绅士而言,只是一个微不足道的缺点.

sentence.Network_en: The venial sins are relatively minor and more easily forgiven.
sentence.Network_cn: 可宽恕的罪都是比较微小且易被原谅的.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: via Old French from late Latin venialis, from venia 'forgiveness'

auth_sentence.content: Our own laws...punished forgery and even more venial crimes with death.

auth_sentence.content: Quarrelling on Christmas Day! as though on any other day these sins were venial.

auth_sentence.content: In his many turns as a politician not quite on the level, his sins were usually venial and therefore forgivable.
